description: Borrowed from French lucratif, from Latin lucrativus (“profitable”), from lucratus, past participle of lucror (“I gain”), from lucrum (“gain”), ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *leh₂w- (“profit, gain”). Compare Spanish lucrar.

adjectives.description: lucrative (comparative more lucrative, superlative most lucrative)

entries.meaning: (military) Of a target: worth attacking; whose destruction is militarily useful.
examples: Command and Control centers and headquarters are strategically important and lucrative targets.
